clusters.title: Where things stand with Trump's tariffs after Supreme Court ruling
clusters.neutral_headline: Trump Tariffs Face Supreme Court Ruling

items.title: Where things stand with Trump's tariffs after Supreme Court ruling
items.standfirst: President Trump is doubling down on his use of tariffs, days after the Supreme Court struck down a pillar of his trade policy. CBS News senior White House correspondent Weijia Jiang has more.
items.content: President Trump is doubling down on his use of tariffs, days after the Supreme Court struck down a pillar of his trade policy. CBS News senior White House correspondent Weijia Jiang has more.

items.title: EU hits pause on trade deal with US, Trump warns countries not to 'play games' after Supreme Court ruling
items.standfirst: After the US Supreme Court struck down his 'liberation day' tariffs as unlawful, Donald Trump doubled down on his trade policy and warned countries around the world not to "play games" with the court ruling and stick to recently-agreed trade deals. The EU meanwhile has decided to hold off on ratifying its agreement with the US while waiting for clarity.
items.content: After the US Supreme Court struck down his 'liberation day' tariffs as unlawful, Donald Trump doubled down on his trade policy and warned countries around the world not to "play games" with the court ruling and stick to recently-agreed trade deals. The EU meanwhile has decided to hold off on ratifying its agreement with the US while waiting for clarity.

items.title: Trump threatens countries that 'play games' with existing trade deals
items.standfirst: The threat comes after the Supreme Court ruled on Friday that Trump had exceeded his authority in enacting a sweeping global programme of tariffs.
items.content: The threat comes after the Supreme Court ruled on Friday that Trump had exceeded his authority in enacting a sweeping global programme of tariffs.

items.title: Tariffs pose "huge uncertainty" after Supreme Court ruling, experts say
items.standfirst: The Trump administration is unlikely to back down from pursuing additional tariffs following the Supreme Court decision, according to trade experts.
items.content: The Trump administration is unlikely to back down from pursuing additional tariffs following the Supreme Court decision, according to trade experts.

items.title: Trump’s new tariff threats trigger economic uncertainty; trade deals stall
items.standfirst: The White House is set to impose a 15 percent tariff through Section 122 after the US Supreme Court ruled against Trump.
items.content: The White House is set to impose a 15 percent tariff through Section 122 after the US Supreme Court ruled against Trump.

items.title: Trump says he’ll raise tariffs to 15% after Supreme Court ruling
items.standfirst: European Union lawmakers Monday put a key trade deal with the United States on hold, demanding clarity after a Supreme Court ruling struck down many of President Donald Trump's tariffs. Speaking on FRANCE 24, Guntram Wolff, Senior Fellow at Bruegel, says that the new tariffs announced by Trump create a lot of uncertainty for European exporters and may push US consumers to postpone purchases.
items.content: European Union lawmakers Monday put a key trade deal with the United States on hold, demanding clarity after a Supreme Court ruling struck down many of President Donald Trump's tariffs. Speaking on FRANCE 24, Guntram Wolff, Senior Fellow at Bruegel, says that the new tariffs announced by Trump create a lot of uncertainty for European exporters and may push US consumers to postpone purchases.

items.title: The US Supreme Court’s ruling won’t stop Donald Trump’s tariffs
items.standfirst: The justices have closed one door of trade policy while leaving an entire corridor wide open
items.content: The justices have closed one door of trade policy while leaving an entire corridor wide open

ai_summary: Trump doubles down on tariffs after Supreme Court ruling
EU pauses trade deal with US due to tariff uncertainty
Trump warns countries not to play games with trade deals
Supreme Court strikes down Trump's liberation day tariffs
Tariffs pose huge uncertainty for trade experts

clusters.title: French minister moves to block US envoy Kushner from government access

items.title: French minister moves to block US envoy Kushner from government access
items.standfirst: The minister says Charles Kushner, father of Trump's son-in-law Jared, had failed to explain US comments about violence in France.
items.content: The minister says Charles Kushner, father of Trump's son-in-law Jared, had failed to explain US comments about violence in France.

items.title: France to revoke US envoy's government access after summons no-show
items.standfirst: France on Monday moved to block US envoy Charles Kushner from having access to government ministers, after he failed to show up to explain comments about a killed far-right activist. Foreign Minister Jean-Noel Barrot summoned Kushner after the US embassy in Paris on Sunday reposted comments by the Trump administration in Washington about Quentin Deranque. FRANCE 24's James Vasina reports.
items.content: France on Monday moved to block US envoy Charles Kushner from having access to government ministers, after he failed to show up to explain comments about a killed far-right activist. Foreign Minister Jean-Noel Barrot summoned Kushner after the US embassy in Paris on Sunday reposted comments by the Trump administration in Washington about Quentin Deranque. FRANCE 24's James Vasina reports.

items.title: France blocks US ambassador’s access to ministers after he fails to show for meeting
items.standfirst: Charles Kushner, father of president’s son-in-law Jared, had been summoned to explain US comments relating to death of far-right activistDonald Trump’s ambassador to France has been banned from meeting French government ministers after failing to show up for a meeting at the foreign ministry to explain US comments about the killing of a far-right activist.Charles Kushner, whose son Jared is married to the US president’s oldest daughter, Ivanka, was summoned to the 7pm meeting by the foreign minister, Jean-Noël Barrot, after the US embassy in Paris reposted state department comments about the case. Continue reading...
items.content: Charles Kushner, father of president’s son-in-law Jared, had been summoned to explain US comments relating to death of far-right activistDonald Trump’s ambassador to France has been banned from meeting French government ministers after failing to show up for a meeting at the foreign ministry to explain US comments about the killing of a far-right activist.Charles Kushner, whose son Jared is married to the US president’s oldest daughter, Ivanka, was summoned to the 7pm meeting by the foreign minister, Jean-Noël Barrot, after the US embassy in Paris reposted state department comments about the case. Continue reading...

items.title: France curtails US Ambassador Kushner's government access after he fails to obey summons
items.standfirst: US Ambassador Charles Kushner "did not appear" after being formally summoned over comments the Trump administration made about the killing of a far-right activist in France, the foreign ministry said on Monday. Kushner will no longer have direct access to government ministers but will be allowed to perform certain diplomatic duties, the ministry said.
items.content: US Ambassador Charles Kushner "did not appear" after being formally summoned over comments the Trump administration made about the killing of a far-right activist in France, the foreign ministry said on Monday. Kushner will no longer have direct access to government ministers but will be allowed to perform certain diplomatic duties, the ministry said.

ai_summary: France blocks US ambassador's government access
Ambassador failed to show up for meeting
Meeting intended to discuss US comments on activist
Ambassador's access limited to certain duties
France demands clarity on US trade policies

items.title: U.S. orders non-essential staff to leave embassy in Beirut as Iran tensions rise
items.standfirst: The State Department has ordered non-essential staff to leave its embassy in Beirut, Lebanon, amid rising tensions in the Middle East. Indirect talks between the U.S. and Iran are set to be held in Geneva this Thursday. Osamah Khalil, chair of the International Relations Program at Syracuse University, joined CBS News to discuss.

clusters.title: Greenland says 'no thanks' to Trump's hospital ship

items.title: Greenland says 'no thanks' to Trump's hospital ship
items.standfirst: Greenland's Prime Minister Jens-Frederik Nielsen said on ​Sunday "no thanks" to U.S. President Donald Trump's idea of sending a hospital ship to Greenland, a territory that Trump has ​repeatedly ‌said he wishes to take over. Trump said ⁠on Saturday on social media he was working with Louisiana Governor and ‌special envoy to Greenland, Jeff Landry, to send a ⁠hospital boat to Greenland.
items.content: Greenland's Prime Minister Jens-Frederik Nielsen said on ​Sunday "no thanks" to U.S. President Donald Trump's idea of sending a hospital ship to Greenland, a territory that Trump has ​repeatedly ‌said he wishes to take over. Trump said ⁠on Saturday on social media he was working with Louisiana Governor and ‌special envoy to Greenland, Jeff Landry, to send a ⁠hospital boat to Greenland.
